Topic.Title: Investor Relations

Message.Msg: I'm wondering where my annual report, ect, is... and my proxy . . . . I've been holding this for a couple years now and have yet to get either. Are they just NOT consulting minority shareholders? While it might be cheaper for them I don't consider my "minority" core position of 2500 shares to be trivial to me, at least from a "percentage of total portfolio" position. I'd sure like a better picture of what's going on rather than having to dig it up out of SEC filings sans the spin. It's not that the spin is significant in and of itself, but I also like it as it gives me an idea of where a company DOESN'T want you to look where it comes to their business model and future product impact. There's not much of that to do with a financial company as there is with a technology company (most of the rest of my portfolio), but I'd STILL like to see it. Holding back for now as ETrade slipped out of my strong buy area, though I'd be buying if I didn't already have a nice core position, but I've shed my temporary position for now even though I added 1,000 shares to my core last year.

Topic.Title: Not good. My first 2013 bi-weekly paycheck

Message.Msg: Don't you know you have a MORAL responsibility to share and help those less fortunate continue their life of trying to succeed by purchasing $40 worth of lottery tickets with their EBT cards every month hoping to "hit the big one", while spending the majority of the rest on necessary sustenance (beer) and food items (chips), and saving a bit to trade for some [fill in drug of proles choice]. Then they go to their section 8 housing with its subsidized internet and watch porn until the football game comes on so they can watch in on their 54" flat screen TV's. A needed item since they save money by also allowing you to connect your PS/3 and your Computer to it. Every two years they get a job for 4 months so they'll qualify for unemployment again, then get let go, and collect unemployment and whatever else for the next two. It's an amazing system. I have section 8 tenant on my property out in the hinterlands and while I got a better batch of folk than most small property owners (ok, not so small, its on a legal 1 acre subdivision of my 40+ acre forest), I can't say my tenants done a DAMN thing to get herself back into the real world since I took her on. When she moved in I was still working (now my MS is bad enough to take me out of the work force, so I trade stocks to try to supplement my income) and was more disabled than she was. Admittedly she was a wreck from fleeing an abusive spouse but still, it's been over 10 years and not only is she is much better shape than when she arrived, she has 4 less kids under her roof than she did then. What's she waiting for? Ahh, right . . . as long as the spigot is open, she'll keep tapping it. There is absolutely NO incentive for her to work toward rehabilitative work since she effective has a far higher net income receiving public benefits than she would being a 40 year old woman entering the work force with virtually no recent real world skills (she had a fairly high paying factory job at one time so gets reasonable SSDI payments compared to a minimum wage worker), despite the fact that she's highly intelligent. As long as our social welfare and disability system disincentivize work by eliminating benefits immediately on a 1:1 basis and terminally at the end of 9 months there will be NO reason for a previously highly paid employee to seek work at a level significant under that which they previous worked at. I'd GLADLY work again if I could, and if I could find someone to hire me. I totally can't understand the mindset. P.S Brilliant and bored software/firmware/sensor engineer, former CTO of an internet gaming company and inventor of technology that allows a game whose total game area encompasses just about every other internet game out there, seeks part time employment on project oversight or development in the Dallas/Fort Worth are, prefer telecommute with as few in office vists as possible. Can operate telepresence hardware, can set up VPN to home. Have in house high speed commercial internet connection vis Verizon FIOS. See resume, CV, whatever I've posted on it via LinkedIn. Look for Stephen W. Evans, Grapevine, TX former employee MIT, IENT, and Playnet. Army veteran. Disabled vet (I think you'd get a tax credit for that). Bored Bored Bored Bored . . . Going out of mind. I don't know how the so called "welfare" class can freaking stand it.

The Muslims will straight up tell you that you're an infidel who's going to burn unless you embrace the Prophet, that Palestine is Dar Al'Islam and that therefore Israel cannot exist as a Jewish state (no matter Zionest or not, all land once conquered by Islam is part of all Islam and to defend it is Jihad, no matter what, no conquest of such land by any infidel can be accepted . . . and thus far, historically, they've made good on that threat, that is Islamic law).
